body_html:
I have found bunch of other issues that have same crash with protobuf's SharedDtor
here tensorflow/fold#37
here tensorflow/deepmath#13
and here #12389
has a comment:
#12389 (comment)

This sounds a little bit like the known caveat of protobuf that one shouldn't share objects from protobuf across library boundaries, lest the global fixed_address_empty_string might get freed?

(This may be no longer an issue in the protobuf being used for tensorflow - i may be out of date..) ?

I will experiment with different builds of protobuf to find if there is any working solution on Mac

body:
I have found bunch of other issues that have same crash with protobuf's SharedDtor
here https://github.com/tensorflow/fold/issues/37
here https://github.com/tensorflow/deepmath/issues/13
and here https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/12389
has a comment:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/12389#issuecomment-323539751
>This sounds a little bit like the known caveat of protobuf that one shouldn't share objects from protobuf across library boundaries, lest the global fixed_address_empty_string might get freed?
>
> (This may be no longer an issue in the protobuf being used for tensorflow - i may be out of date..) ?

I will experiment with different builds of protobuf to find if there is any working solution on Mac
